title: UPDATE: 6-year-old shot in altercation recovering from surgery
content:
SAN ANTONIO -- According to the San Antonio Police Department, a 6-year-old girl was shot in the back while in a car with her family on the eastside.
SAPD said around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday night, on the 4600 block of East Houston, a family pulled into an apartment complex as they were trying to find their way to a tire shop. Police say they were trying to turn around. Their car headlights shined into the car of the suspected gunman. Police say for some reason that made him angry and he pulled out a gun. The family tried to get away by driving into the apartment complex, but investigators say the suspect followed, firing at them around nine times.
One of the bullets went through the car and hit the little girl in the back. She went through surgery because the bullet may be lodged near her spine.
SAPD says the family managed to make it to the 200 block of South WW White Road where they spotted a patrol car and pulled over at a motel parking lot for help.
SAPD said officers took a person of interest into custody who was reportedly driving a car that matched the suspected car involved. However, police said that person was arrested on an unrelated felony warrant, felony evading and resisting arrest.
Police said that person has not been charged in connection with the shooting and is considered a person of interest.
According to SAPD, the child was able to receive medical attention and was in surgery shortly after the incident. More information on her condition was not immediately available.
This is a developing story, and Kens5.com will continue to post updates.
